body:
Presented in the section below are new rules for animal and terrain domains—domains for druids whose focus is more specific than the Animal, Plant, Weather, or elemental domains. A druid with the nature's bond ability can choose an animal domain or terrain domain. Just like cleric domains, animal and terrain domains have granted powers and domain spells, and a druid who selects an animal or terrain domain gains a domain spell slot at each level. A druid who worships a deity (as opposed to nature in general) cannot select an animal or terrain domain that contradicts or is outside of the portfolio of her deity.

If an animal or terrain domain ability calls for a saving throw, the DC of the save is equal to 10 + 1/2 the character's druid level + her Wisdom modifier.

Other nature-themed classes with access to domains may select an animal or terrain domain in place of a regular domain.
name: Animal and Terrain Domains
url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Druid/Animal and Terrain Domains

sections.name: Aquatic Domain
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Druid/Animal and Terrain Domains/Aquatic Domain

sections.body: You master the deeps of the sea, raging rivers, flowing falls, and relentless tides.
sections.name: Granted Powers

sections.body: You can channel energy (as a cleric of your druid level) a number of times per day equal to 3 + your Charisma modifier, but only to heal creatures with the aquatic or water subtype or to command them (similar to using the Command Undead feat against undead). You can take other feats to add to this ability, such as Extra Channel and Improved Channel, but not feats that alter this ability, such as Elemental Channel and Alignment Channel. The DC to save against this ability is equal to 10 + 1/2 your druid level + your Charisma modifier.
sections.name: Sealord
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Druid/Animal and Terrain Domains/Aquatic Domain/Sealord

sections.body: At 6th level, as a free action, you may use natural and manufactured weapons in water as if you had continuous freedom of movement. As a standard action, you can throw a weapon underwater without the normal penalties for throwing weapons; if your target is in or under the water, the weapon also acts as a returning weapon (see page 471 of the Core Rulebook) for that attack.
sections.name: Seastrike
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Druid/Animal and Terrain Domains/Aquatic Domain/Seastrike

sections.body: 1st—hydraulic push, 2nd—slipstream, 3rd—water breathing, 4th—freedom of movement, 5th—black tentacles, 6th—freezing sphere, 7th—animal shapes (aquatic creatures only), 8th—seamantle, 9th—tsunami.
sections.name: Domain Spells
Arctic Domain
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Druid/Animal and Terrain Domains/Arctic Domain

sections.body: You master the might of the endless, snow-covered wastes beneath the midnight sun, where icy polar winds blow.
sections.name: Granted Powers

sections.body: You can channel energy (as a cleric of your druid level) a number of times per day equal to 3 + your Charisma modifier, but only to heal creatures with the cold subtype or to command them (similar to using the Command Undead feat against undead). You can take other feats that add to this ability, such as Extra Channel and Improved Channel, but not feats that alter this ability, such as Elemental Channel and Alignment Channel. The DC to save against this ability is equal to 10 + 1/2 your druid level + your Charisma modifier.
sections.name: Call Cold
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Druid/Animal and Terrain Domains/Arctic Domain/Call Cold

sections.body: At 6th level, you may use your call cold ability to damage creatures with the fire subtype (as a cleric channeling negative energy) or to cause them to flee from you (as the Turn Undead feat). Alternatively, you may use this ability to negate magical fire effects as if using a targeted dispel magic; at 12th level, this functions as targeted or area greater dispel magic instead of dispel magic.
sections.name: Banish Flame
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Druid/Animal and Terrain Domains/Arctic Domain/Banish Flame

sections.body: 1st—frostbite, 2nd—aspect of the bear, 3rd—sleet storm, 4th—wall of ice, 5th—aspect of the wolf, 6th—freezing sphere, 7th—wind walk, 8th—polar ray, 9th—polar midnight.
sections.name: Domain Spells
Cave Domain
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Druid/Animal and Terrain Domains/Cave Domain

sections.body: The wonders and dark secrets of the deepest caves give you strength.
sections.name: Granted Powers

sections.body: You can grant darkvision 60 feet to a willing creature you touch. This effect lasts 1 minute, or 1 hour if used on yourself. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your Wisdom modifier.
sections.name: Cavesight
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Druid/Animal and Terrain Domains/Cave Domain/Cavesight

sections.body: At 6th level, you gain tremorsense 30 feet. At 12th level, you gain tremorsense 60 feet.
sections.name: Tremorsense
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Druid/Animal and Terrain Domains/Cave Domain/Tremorsense

sections.body: 1st—detect aberration, 2nd—stone call, 3rd—deeper darkness, 4th—echolocation, 5th—wall of stone, 6th—conjure black pudding, 7th—statue (looking like a stalagmite or stalactite), 8th—earthquake, 9th—imprisonment.
sections.name: Domain Spells
Desert Domain
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Druid/Animal and Terrain Domains/Desert Domain

sections.body: The spirits and secrets of the endless wastes are yours to command.
sections.name: Granted Powers

sections.body: As a free action, you can surround yourself with heat distortion that acts as the blur spell. Creatures that strike you in melee while you're using this ability are dazzled for 1 round (Fortitude negates). You may use this ability for a number of rounds per day equal to 3 + your Wisdom modifier. These rounds need not be consecutive.
sections.name: Heat Shimmer
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Druid/Animal and Terrain Domains/Desert Domain/Heat Shimmer

sections.body: At 8th level, once per day, you may call upon the aid of a janni as if using lesser planar ally. At 12th level, you may call upon the aid of any type of common (non-noble) genie as if using planar ally. At 16th level, you may call upon the aid of a noble genie as if using greater planar ally. If you use this power while in desert terrain, you need not make an offering to call the creature(s), and the cost of any service is halved.
sections.name: Servant of the Sands
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Druid/Animal and Terrain Domains/Desert Domain/Servant of the Sands

sections.body: 1st—cloak of shade, 2nd—shifting sand, 3rd—cup of dust, 4th—hallucinatory terrain, 5th—transmute rock to mud (creates loose sand instead of mud), 6th—sirocco, 7th—sunbeam, 8th—sunburst, 9th—horrid wilting.
sections.name: Domain Spells
Eagle Domain
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Druid/Animal and Terrain Domains/Eagle Domain

sections.body: Your spirit soars with the mightiest and noblest of all winged creatures.
sections.name: Granted Powers

sections.body: You gain a hawk familiar. Your effective wizard level for this ability is equal to your druid level. Your druid level stacks with levels from other classes that grant familiars when determining the powers of your familiar.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Druid/Animal and Terrain Domains/Eagle Domain/Familiar
sections.name: Familiar

sections.body: As a swift action, you may add a bonus equal to half your druid level (minimum +1) on one ranged attack or on one Perception check. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your Wisdom modifier.
sections.name: Hawkeye
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Druid/Animal and Terrain Domains/Eagle Domain/Hawkeye

sections.body: At 6th level, you gain the evasion ability (as a rogue) when you are flying. At 12th level, you gain improved evasion while flying.
sections.name: Aerial evasion
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Druid/Animal and Terrain Domains/Eagle Domain/Aerial evasion

sections.body: 1st—aspect of the falcon, 2nd—eagle's splendor, 3rd—fly, 4th—river of wind, 5th—overland flight, 6th—eagle aerie, 7th—animal shapes (birds only), 8th—sunburst, 9th—winds of vengeance.
sections.name: Domain Spells
Frog Domain
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Druid/Animal and Terrain Domains/Frog Domain

sections.body: You venerate the elder amphibians that first brought life to land.
sections.name: Granted Powers

sections.body: You may gain a toad familiar. Your effective wizard level for this ability is equal to your druid level. Your druid level stacks with levels from other classes that grant familiars when determining the powers of your familiar.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Druid/Animal and Terrain Domains/Frog Domain/Familiar
sections.name: Familiar

sections.body: As a standard action, you can attempt a ranged touch attack with a sticky tendril against a target up to 15 feet away, then use the pull universal monster ability to pull the target 5 feet toward you. You gain a bonus on the pull's combat maneuver check equal to 1/2 your druid level. If the target is larger than you, you may pull yourself 5 feet toward the target without making a check. The target can remove the tendril by making an opposed Strength check as a standard action, or by dealing enough slashing damage to the tendril (hit points equal to your druid level, Armor Class equal to your touch Armor Class). You can dissolve the tendril as a free action. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your Wisdom modifier.
sections.name: Sticky Strike
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Druid/Animal and Terrain Domains/Frog Domain/Sticky Strike

sections.body: At 6th level, you gain the amphibious special quality and a swim speed equal to your land speed. At 12th level, you gain a climb speed equal to your land speed.
sections.name: Webfoot
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Druid/Animal and Terrain Domains/Frog Domain/Webfoot

sections.body: 1st—jump, 2nd—delay poison, 3rd—lily pad stride, 4th—shout, 5th—blessing of the salamander, 6th—confusion, 7th—animal shapes (amphibians only), 8th—greater shout, 9th—summon froghemoth.
sections.name: Domain Spells
Jungle Domain
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Druid/Animal and Terrain Domains/Jungle Domain

sections.body: The spirits of the jungle, both of natural guardians and lost civilizations, whisper in your heart.
sections.name: Granted Powers

sections.body: As a free action for a number of rounds per day equal to your druid level, you may climb with a climb speed equal to your land speed, and gain a bonus on Acrobatics checks equal to your druid level. These rounds do not have to be consecutive.
sections.name: Brachiation
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Druid/Animal and Terrain Domains/Jungle Domain/Brachiation

sections.body: At 3rd level, you gain the trap sense ability. This is identical to the rogue class ability. Your effective rogue level is equal to your druid level for the purpose of determining your trap sense bonus. Trap sense bonuses gained from multiple classes stack.
sections.name: Trap Sense
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Druid/Animal and Terrain Domains/Jungle Domain/Trap Sense

sections.body: 1st—glide, 2nd—tar ball, 3rd—venomous bolt, 4th—arboreal hammer, 5th—blessing of the salamander, 6th—swarm skin, 7th—creeping doom, 8th—wall of lava, 9th—shambler.
sections.name: Domain Spells
Monkey Domain
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Druid/Animal and Terrain Domains/Monkey Domain

sections.body: The balanced wisdom, skill, agility, and playfulness of the monkey are the model for your spiritual discipline.
sections.name: Granted Powers

sections.body: You gain a monkey familiar. Your effective wizard level for this ability is equal to your druid level. Your druid level stacks with levels from other classes that grant familiars when determining the powers of your familiar.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Druid/Animal and Terrain Domains/Monkey Domain/Familiar
sections.name: Familiar

sections.body: As a free action, you may add a competence bonus equal to half your druid level (minimum of +1) on one Acrobatics, Climb, Disable Device, or Sleight of Hand check. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your Wisdom modifier.
sections.name: Monkey Athletics
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Druid/Animal and Terrain Domains/Monkey Domain/Monkey Athletics

sections.body: At 6th level, you can use the Disable Device and Sleight of Hand skills at a range of 30 feet. Working at a distance increases the normal skill check DC by 5, and you cannot take 10 on this check. Any object to be manipulated must weigh 5 pounds or less. You can only use this ability if you have at least 1 rank in the skill being used.
sections.name: Ranged Legerdemain
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Druid/Animal and Terrain Domains/Monkey Domain/Ranged Legerdemain

sections.body: 1st—beguiling gift, 2nd—spider climb, 3rd—cacophonous call, 4th—freedom of movement, 5th—summon nature's ally V (dire ape or girallon only), 6th—confusion, 7th—animal shapes (apes and monkeys only), 8th—clenched fist, 9th—foresight.
sections.name: Domain Spells
Mountain Domain
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Druid/Animal and Terrain Domains/Mountain Domain

sections.body: You have mastered the mighty powers of the great mountains that pierce the sky and stand aloof above the lowlands.
sections.name: Granted Powers

sections.body: As a standard action, you can cause an adjacent stone surface up to 10 feet square to mold itself into ridges and creases. A foothold that is created on a horizontal surface is treated as difficult terrain, and a Medium or smaller creature standing in the area or moving through it takes a –2 penalty on Acrobatics checks and to CMD due to poor footing. A foothold that is created on a vertical surface grants a +10 bonus on Climb checks to climb it. The stone remains altered for 1 hour. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your Wisdom modifier.
sections.name: Foothold
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Druid/Animal and Terrain Domains/Mountain Domain/Foothold

sections.body: At 8th level, as a free action, you can surround yourself with a 5-foot aura of supernaturally thin air that draws the breath from creatures adjacent to you. Creatures beginning their turn in the aura are fatigued (Fortitude negates). A fatigued creature that begins its turn in the aura must save or suffer from altitude sickness, taking 1 point of ability damage to all ability scores. At 16th level, the aura increases to 10 feet. Creatures that do not breathe are immune to this aura. You can use this ability for a number of rounds per day equal to your druid level; the rounds need not be consecutive.
sections.name: Thin Air
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Druid/Animal and Terrain Domains/Mountain Domain/Thin Air

sections.body: 1st—fist of stone, 2nd—stone call, 3rd—cloak of winds, 4th—stoneskin, 5th—geyser, 6th—suffocate, 7th—flesh to stone, 8th—reverse gravity, 9th—clashing rocks.
sections.name: Domain Spells
Plains Domain
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Druid/Animal and Terrain Domains/Plains Domain

sections.body: The wide open spaces of the prairie, savanna, and steppe are yours to master.
sections.name: Granted Powers

sections.body: When you summon an aurochs, bison, elephant, horse, mastodon, pony, or similar quadruped herbivore with a summoning spell, the duration of the spell is increased by 100% (this does not stack with Extend Spell). The creature's land speed is increased by 10 feet.
sections.name: Migrating Herd
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Druid/Animal and Terrain Domains/Plains Domain/Migrating Herd

sections.body: At 6th level, you may use the pounce special attack once per day. You may pounce one additional time per day for every 3 levels after 6th.
sections.name: Pounce
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Druid/Animal and Terrain Domains/Plains Domain/Pounce

sections.body: 1st—mount, 2nd—chameleon stride, 3rd—haste, 4th—aspect of the stag, 5th—control winds, 6th—find the path, 7th—whirlwind, 8th—animal shapes, 9th—worldwave.
sections.name: Domain Spells
Serpent Domain
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Druid/Animal and Terrain Domains/Serpent Domain

sections.body: You serve ancient serpentine mysteries whose coils still encircle the world.
sections.name: Granted Powers

sections.body: You gain a viper familiar. Your effective wizard level for this ability is equal to your druid level. Your druid level stacks with levels from other classes that grant familiars when determining the powers of your familiar.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Druid/Animal and Terrain Domains/Serpent Domain/Familiar
sections.name: Familiar

sections.body: As a free action, you can distend and stretch your body to fit easily through narrow spaces for 1 round. You can move freely through a tight space that would normally require a creature of your size to squeeze through. While slithering, you gain a +2 dodge bonus to Armor Class against attacks of opportunity provoked by your movement and a +2 bonus on CMB and on Escape Artist checks made to escape from a grapple. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your Wisdom modifier.
sections.name: Slither
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Druid/Animal and Terrain Domains/Serpent Domain/Slither

sections.body: At 6th level, you gain immunity to poisons from snakes, reptiles, and creatures with the reptilian subtype. At 12th level, you gain immunity to all poisons. This replaces venom immunity.
sections.name: Venom Immunity
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Druid/Animal and Terrain Domains/Serpent Domain/Venom Immunity

sections.body: 1st—charm animal, 2nd—animal trance, 3rd—poison, 4th—strong jaw, 5th—snakestaff, 6th—charm monster, 7th—animal shapes (reptiles and snakes only), 8th—scintillating pattern, 9th—crushing hand.
sections.name: Domain Spells
Swamp Domain
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Druid/Animal and Terrain Domains/Swamp Domain

sections.body: The sour-sweet depths of bogs, marshes, and swamps are your places of power.
sections.name: Granted Powers

sections.body: You can channel energy (as a cleric of your druid level) a number of times per day equal to 3 + your Charisma modifier, but only to heal animals, plants, and vermin. You may reduce the number of dice healed to cure ability damage (your choice) to all affected creatures, curing 1 point of ability damage for each d6 that the channel energy is reduced. You can take other feats to add to this ability, such as Extra Channel, but not feats that alter this ability, such as Elemental Channel and Alignment Channel.
sections.name: Natural Healing
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Druid/Animal and Terrain Domains/Swamp Domain/Natural Healing

sections.body: At 6th level, you gain blindsense 30 feet with respect to concealment and cover from fog, vegetation, or water. At 12th level, this improves to blindsight 30 feet with respect to these conditions.
sections.name: Reed Hunter
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Druid/Animal and Terrain Domains/Swamp Domain/Reed Hunter

sections.body: 1st—hydraulic push, 2nd—burst of nettles, 3rd—lily pad stride, 4th—cape of wasps, 5th—insect plague, 6th—mass fester, 7th—animate plants, 8th—blood mist, 9th—shambler.
sections.name: Domain Spells
Wolf Domain
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Druid/Animal and Terrain Domains/Wolf Domain

sections.body: You run with the pack and are the master of the cold hunt of your spirit totem.
sections.name: Granted Powers

sections.body: You gain Improved Trip as a bonus feat.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Druid/Animal and Terrain Domains/Wolf Domain/Improved Trip
sections.name: Improved Trip

sections.body: At 8th level, as a free action on your turn, you can designate an adjacent square; your attacks are treated as coming from that square for the purposes of determining whether or not you are flanking (this applies even if that square is occupied by an object or creature). This ends at the start of your next turn or if you move. If you are flanking a creature without using this ability, you may add your Wisdom bonus to your attack roll rather than the normal +2 flanking bonus. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your Wisdom modifier.
sections.name: Pack Tactics
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Druid/Animal and Terrain Domains/Wolf Domain/Pack Tactics

sections.body: 1st—hunter's howl, 2nd—bloodhound, 3rd—aspect of the wolf, 4th—strong jaw, 5th—tireless pursuers, 6th—find the path, 7th—animal shapes (canines only), 8th—phantasmal revenge, 9th—freedom.
sections.name: Domain Spells
